intro: Aulomyrcia salzmannii, commonly known as the Salzmann's aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
